articles.description: The table `articles` contains an inventory of scientific articles reporting biochar incubation experiments.

fields.name: ID_art
fields.description: The unique identifier (integer) given to an article containing biochar incubation observations. The identifer is also used in the tables data & metadata.

fields.name: AuthorDate
fields.description: A short text identifier of the article with last name of first author and publication year.

fields.name: FullCitation
fields.description: The full citation of the article, in text format.

fields.name: DOI
fields.description: The DOI of the article, for easy online access.

fields.name: ContactAuthor
fields.description: Email address of the contact author of the manuscript, as available in published article, or as in mail correspondance with author.

fields.name: RawData_status
fields.description: Describes whether the raw data (incubation data `D` & metadata `M`) are available in the database. Values can a combination of "D:yes/no", "M:yes/no", "Reason:text". For instance: "D:yes, M:yes". Or: "D:no, M:yes, Reason: Articles corresponds to 1-year experiment, which are the same as in Fang2014a where data is reported for 2 years."

fields.name: RawData_remark
fields.longName: Remark on the status of the raw data
fields.description: How was the data collected (from author, digitized, supporting information, from other person than authors) or why it was not possible to collect the data (author contacted but no reply received).

fields.name: RawData_copyright
fields.description: Describes to what extent the data can be shared in a public database. By default, the value is `NotPublic`.  It can be labelled `Public` if the data was obtained from authors with their approval for sharing, if it was digitized manually, or if the article was published open-source. TO_DO: discuss that.

fields.name: IsolatedBiocharFlux
fields.description: Whether the articles has performed experiments so as to be able to measure biochar C fluxes separately from other C sources (soil, co-amendments). Possible values: yes/no/yes, but…/na(not applicable)

fields.name: NbObs
fields.description: The number of observations reported in this article (replicates of a given experimental setup count as a single observation).

fields.name: Spokas2010
fields.description: Whether the article was included in the earlier biochar stability estimates by Spokas (2010).

fields.name: Singh2012
fields.description: Whether the article was included in the earlier biochar stability estimates by Singh (2012).

fields.name: Budai2013
fields.description: Whether the article was included in the earlier biochar stability estimates by Budai (2013), non-peer reviewed work performed for the International Biochar Institute.

fields.name: Wang2016
fields.description: Whether the article was included in the earlier biochar stability estimates by Wang (2016).

fields.name: Lehmann2019
fields.description: Whether the article was included in the earlier biochar stability estimates by Lehmann (2019), referring to the appendix of the 2019 revision of the IPCC greenhouse gas inventory guidelines.

fields.name: Woolf2021
fields.description: Whether the article was included in the earlier biochar stability estimates by Woolf (2021).

data.description: The table `data` contains the decomposition time series for each individual observation (statistical average of the replicates). Depending on how the incubation data is reported, the 3 variables (biochar remaining, biochar decomposed, biochar decay rate) can be re-calculated knowing at least one of them.

fields.name: ID_obs
fields.description: The unique identifier (integer) given to a biochar incubation observation, i.e. any single experiment leading to a decay curve for a given biochar in a given environment, including replicates. Same field as in the tables article & metadata.

fields.name: ID_art
fields.description: The unique identifier (integer) given to a peer-reviewed article reporting biochar incubation data. Same field as in the tables article & metadata.

fields.name: time
fields.description: Time of incubation starting at t=0 when incubation starts. Usually, at t=0, the biochar decomposed is equal to 0 and the amount remaining is equal to 100. Time values, in days, can be of type float (decimals) when data were retrieved by digitizing figures.

fields.name: date
fields.description: The actual date when the experiment was performed, an approximative starting date is usually reported for lab incubations, while for field trials, dates are reported

metadata.description: The table `metadata` contains a set of metadata describing the experimental conditions of each biochar incubation. The fields in this table relate to the type of biomass, the pyrolysis conditions, the biochar properties, and the incubation conditions.

fields.name: ID_obs
fields.description: The unique identifier (integer) given to a biochar incubation observation, i.e. any single experiment leading to a decay curve for a given biochar in a given environment, including replicates. Same field as in the tables article & metadata.

fields.name: ID_art
fields.description: The unique identifier (integer) given to a peer-reviewed article reporting biochar incubation data. Same field as in the tables article & data.

fields.name: AuthorDate
fields.description: A short text identifier of the article with last name of first author and publication year.

fields.name: NameObs
fields.longName: Name or identifier of the observation in the original research article
fields.description: The name or identifier of the observation as in the original article from which it is taken. This field allows to easily cross-check the information collected from the original article.

fields.name: Replicates
fields.description: The number of replicates performed for this specific observation.

fields.name: Biomass
fields.description: The name the biomass used to produce biochar. Text can be as detailed as necessary (e.g. type, species, cultivation details).

fields.name: BiomassClass
fields.description: Classification of the biomass feedstocks in a few number of categories: wood, grass, crop-residue, manure, biosolids. TO_DO: agree on a list of classes.

fields.name: BiomassLignin
fields.description: The average lignin content of the biomass feedstock, either reported from the authors or taken from database on biomass properties.

fields.name: Pyrolysis
fields.description: Brief description of the pyrolysis process (e.g. reactor type, brand, scale, process conditions).

fields.name: PyrolysisClass
fields.description: Classification of the pyrolysis processes into a few number of categories: pyr-slow, gas, htc, pyr-flash, no-treat, torr. Note: no-treat can be used to describe raw biomass incubation.

fields.name: HHT
fields.description: The Highest Treatment Temperature reached during the pyrolysis, as reported in the article. Note: there is an uncertainty related to determination of pyrolysis temperature.

fields.name: RT
fields.longName: Pyrolysis Residence time at the Highest Treatment Temperature
fields.description: The residence time at the Highest Treatment Temperature during the pyrolysis. Note: often difficult to distinguish the total residence time in the reactor from the residence time at the highest treatment temperature, in the information available in articles.

fields.name: HR
fields.description: The pyrolysis heating rate, i.e. the average speed at which the biomass feedstock is heated during the pyrolysis, until it reaches the highest treatment temperature, as reported in the article.

fields.name: Soil type
fields.description: Brief description of the soil type used for the incubation, e.g. using soil classification standards.

fields.name: Soil clay content
fields.description: Clay content of the soil, as reported by authors.

fields.name: Soil sand content
fields.description: Sand content of the soil, as reported by authors.

fields.name: Soil silt content
fields.description: Silt content of the soil, as reported by authors.

fields.name: Soil organic matter content
fields.longName: Organic matter content of the soil
fields.description: Organic matter content of the soil, as reported by authors (neglecting inorganic carbon content). TO_DO: decide if total carbon content rather than organic matter content is preferable?.

fields.name: SoilMoisture_Absolute
fields.longName: Absolute moisture content of the soil
fields.description: Absolute moisture content of the soil, as reported by authors. It can be maintained constant in laboratory incubations, while it may vary with climate in field experiments. In that case, a climatic average can be reported.

fields.name: SoilMoisture_WHC
fields.longName: Moisture content of the soil relative to WHC
fields.description: Moisture content of the soil relative to the soil's water holding capacity, as reported by authors. It can be maintained constant in laboratory incubations, while it may vary with climate in field experiments. In that case, a climatic average can be reported.

fields.name: pH_soil
fields.description: pH of the soil before mixing addition of biochar

fields.name: pH_bc-soil
fields.description: pH of the soil after addition of biochar

fields.name: SoilOrigin
fields.longName: Geographic origin of the soil sample
fields.description: Geographic origin of the soil sample used for incubation, reported as a text value.

fields.name: SoilGeolocation
fields.longName: Geographical coordinates of the soil sample
fields.description: Geographical coordinates of the site of extraction of the soil sample, given as a tuple (latitude, longitude) in decimal format. If only a region is given, the approximative center of the region is used.

fields.name: LabField
fields.description: Whether the incubation is carried out in a lab environment (`lab`) or in the field (`field`).

fields.name: Cultivated
fields.description: Whether the plants are cultivated in the incubation experiment, `yes` or `no`.

fields.name: IncubationTemperature
fields.description: For lab experiments, average incubation temperature as reported by authors. For field experiments, climatic average temperature at the field where the experiment is located.

fields.name: IncubationDuration
fields.description: During of the incubation experiment, expressed in days.

fields.name: ApplicationRate
fields.longName: Biochar application rate to the soil
fields.description: Biochar application rate to the soil.

fields.name: TotalFluxMeasurement
fields.description: How the total flux of decomposed carbon dioxide was measured in the incubation. This field can be e.g. titration

fields.name: BiocharFluxDetermination
fields.description: How the fraction of the total flux of decomposed carbon dioxide attributed to biochar was determined. This field can take one of the following values: `13C natural abundance`, `13C depleted`, `14C labeled`, `13C labeled`, `13C isotopic signature`, `Headspace CO2, coulometer, no other source of C in soil`. TO_DO: some namings may be equivalent, to check.

fields.name: OtherIncubationDescription
fields.description: Other information on the incubation experimental setup not covered in other fields. In particular: aged biochar process if any; microbial activity measures or community stucture.

fields.name: AssociatedControl
fields.description: Whether the biochar incubation was performed alongside a control incubation without biochar: `yes`, `no`

fields.name: Ash550
fields.description: Biochar ash content at 550°C as determined in lab analysis. TO_DO: add references to appropriate laboratory methods (DIN, ASTM).

fields.name: Ash700
fields.description: Biochar ash content at 700°C as determined in lab analysis. TO_DO: add references to appropriate laboratory methods (DIN, ASTM).

fields.name: Carbon
fields.description: Biochar (total) carbon content, as determined in lab analysis.

fields.name: Carbon, organic
fields.description: Biochar organic carbon content, as determined in lab analysis.

fields.name: Hydrogen
fields.description: Biochar hydrogen content, as determined in lab analysis.

fields.name: Nitrogen
fields.description: Biochar nitrogen content, as determined in lab analysis.

fields.name: Sulphur
fields.description: Biochar sulphur content, as determined in lab analysis.

fields.name: Oxygen
fields.description: Biochar oxygen content, as determined in lab analysis or more commonly calculated as 100-C-H-N-S.

fields.name: Magnesium
fields.description: Biochar magnesium content, as determined in lab analysis.

fields.name: Potassium
fields.description: Biochar potassium content, as determined in lab analysis.

fields.name: Phosphorous
fields.description: Biochar phosphorous content

fields.name: H/C_org
fields.longName: Hydrogen to organic carbon molar ratio
fields.description: Hydrogen to organic carbon molar ratio of the biochar sample, either as reported by authors or recaculated from elemental composition. TO_DO: discuss what to do if C_org or H is not reported; if we know about ash composition or not, re-estimate C_org or H from the rest?

fields.name: H/C_tot
fields.description: Hydrogen to total carbon molar ratio of the biochar sample, either as reported by authors or recaculated from elemental composition.

fields.name: O/C_org
fields.longName: Oxygen to organic carbon molar ratio
fields.description: Oxygen to organic carbon molar ratio of the biochar sample, either as reported by authors or recaculated from elemental composition. TO_DO: discuss whether to include it at all, whether it should be O/C or O_org/C_org or O/C_org, knowing O_org is never/impractical to measure. Argument to include O/C: reproduce earlier Spokas 2010 results.

fields.name: C/N
fields.description: Carbon to nitrogen molar ratio of the biochar sample, either as reported by authors or recaculated from elemental composition.

fields.name: pH_H2O
fields.description: pH of the biochar sample in water, at 1:5 ratio.

fields.name: pH_CaCl2
fields.description: pH of the biochar sample in calcium chloride, at 1:5 ratio.

fields.name: CEC
fields.description: Cation Exchange Capacity of biochar sample

fields.name: SA_N2
fields.description: Surface area of biochar sample measured with dinitrogen gas.

fields.name: SA_CO2
fields.description: Surface area of biochar sample measured with carbon dioxide gas.

fields.name: FixedCarbon
fields.description: Fixed carbon of biochar sample as determined in proximate analysis.

fields.name: VolatileMatter
fields.description: Volatile matter of biochar sample as determined in proximate analysis.

fields.name: ParticleSize
fields.description: Average biochar particle size at the time of incubation.

fields.name: BulkDensity
fields.description: Bulk density of incubated biochar, measured at its particle size (not grinded), untapped. TO_DO: discuss whether needed (rarely available)

fields.name: TrueDensity
fields.description: True density of incubated biochar, as measured in laboratory analysis (finely grinded).

fields.name: OxidationH2O2
fields.method: Cross, A.; Sohi, S.P. A method for screening the relative long-term stability of biochar. GCB Bioenergy 2013, 5, 215-220
fields.description: Chemical oxidation with hydrogen peroxide, according to Edinburgh stability test.

fields.name: BiocharYield
fields.description: The pyrolysis yield as biochar dry mass over biomass dry mass

fields.name: δ ¹³C biochar
fields.description: Ratio of isotopes 13C / 12C in the biochar studied

fields.name: δ ¹³C soil
fields.description: Ratio of isotopes 13C / 12C in the soil studied

fields.name: ID_Lehmann2019
fields.longName: Identifier of this observation in Lehmann 2019 raw data (see Excel files in folder former-assessments)
fields.description: Identifier of this observation in Lehmann 2019 raw data (see Excel files in folder former-assessments)

fields.name: ID_Woolf2021
fields.longName: Identifier of this observation in Woolf 2021 (see Excel files in folder former-assessments)
fields.description: Identifier of this observation in Woolf 2021 (see Excel files in folder former-assessments)

fields.name: ID_Lehmann2021
fields.longName: Identifier of this observation in Lehmann 2021 (see Excel files in folder former-assessments)
fields.description: Identifier of this observation in Lehmann 2021 (see Excel files in folder former-assessments)

validation.description: The table `metadata_validation` contains two additional fields for each field in the `metadata` tables. The table `metadata_validation` is used for data validation, tracability and transparency. The two fields are `fieldName_comment` and `fieldName_loci`. The field `fieldName_comment` describes how the metadata was retrieved and if any assumptions/calculations were made by the person compiling the data. The field `fieldName_loci` explains where the metadata was found, e.g. Article, Table 3; Article, Section 2.3, p230; SupportingMaterial, Table S3; SupportingMaterial, Excel; DocumentFromAuthors; ReferenceInArticle, Table 2. If needed.
